p: The 2.20-diphenyl-1-picrylhydrazyl (DPPH) assay is commonly applied for the estimation of the antioxidant activity of plant extracts [ 39], and is related to the respective activity against lipid oxidation, which in turn affects food shelf life and human health [ 12, 40]. The DPPH radical-scavenging activity was determined using a standard method [ 41].
